caller_intent: Kenneth Holston, as executor of his late father's estate, seeks temporary homeowners insurance for a property being sold, facing rejection from State Farm and Progressive due to unclear ownership documentation.
resolution_steps: Heather acknowledges the situation and confirms the property's insurance lapsed due to State Farm's requirement for a deed showing ownership transfer.
She explains Progressive referred the caller to Alliance Insurance Services.
Heather recommends North Carolina Joint Underwriters Association (NCJUA) for short-term coverage, noting their limitations (no liability coverage, only fire/hurricane damage).
Clarifies NCJUA's role and confirms Kenneth's acceptance of the recommendation.
knowledge_required: Understanding of NCJUA's coverage scope and limitations
Insurance underwriting for properties in transition (e.g., estates, sales)
summary: Kenneth Holston, managing his father's estate, needs temporary insurance for a property being sold while awaiting legal paperwork. Heather recommends NCJUA for short-term fire/hurricane coverage, noting their exclusion of liability. Kenneth accepts the solution, prioritizing property protection over liability coverage.
